intro: Piper subbrunneispicum, commonly known as the brownish-barked pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, oval-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are unisexual, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same plant. The fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that contains several seeds.
